snippet: Seeking better results, the city divided Adlai E. Stevenson High School in the Bronx into nine theme-based institutions; today the Stevenson Campus has the most schools under one roof anywhere in the city.
abstract: Adlai E Stevenson High School in the Bronx, one of 63 large, low-performing schools closed by city, has become home to nine smaller, more specialized schools under one roof, now called Stevenson Campus; transformation is part of Mayor Michael R Bloomberg's plan to open smaller, often theme-based schools to replace big schools and give students more supportive experience; success varies wildly from floor to floor.

byline.original: By LIZ ROBBINS and THEODORIC MEYER

lead_paragraph: Seeking better results, the city divided Adlai E. Stevenson High School in the Bronx into nine theme-based institutions; today the Stevenson Campus has the most schools under one roof anywhere in the city.

headline.seo: At the Stevenson Campus, Nine High Schools, One Roof
